column1: Summary

[{'summary_text': 'Roast chicken in a large cast-iron skillet until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of breast registers 155°F, 50–60 minutes. Meanwhile, roast squash on lower rack until mostly tender, about 25 minutes.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Roast the potatoes until they are crispy and tender when poked with a knife.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Bring evaporated milk and whole milk to a bare simmer in a large saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, pepper, and 1 tsp. salt. Working in batches, whisk in three fourths of the cheddar, then all of the cream cheese.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Bread can be toasted 3 days ahead and kept (once cool) in a sealed bag at room temperature. Stuffing can be prepared (but not baked) 4 hours before roasting turkey.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Stir together brown sugar and hot water in a cocktail shaker. Add bourbon, lemon juice, and apple butter and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with orange twist and cinnamon.'}]
[{'summary_text': '2 chamomile tea bags, 1 ½ cups boiling water. Add 1 ½ oz. reposado tequila, ¾ oz. fresh lemon juice, and 1 Tbsp. agave nectar.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Add 3 oz. Grand Marnier, 1 oz. Amaro Averna, and a small pat of salted butter to a 16-ounce travel mug or large heatproof measuring cup. Add 1 cup hot apple cider and stir until butter melts.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'For the turmeric syrup, combine ½ cup hot water and ¼ cup sugar in a liquid measuring cup or mason jar. Add ¾ tsp. ground turmeric and stir—or seal and shake—until sugar is completely dissolved.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'For the turmeric syrup, combine ½ cup hot water and ¼ cup sugar in a liquid measuring cup or mason jar. Add ¾ tsp. ground turmeric and stir—or seal and shake—until sugar is completely dissolved.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a medium, oven-safe pan, heat 1 Tbsp. olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 large, thinly sliced onion and ½ tsp. Kosher salt. Cook, stirring often, until golden brown, about 25 minutes. Add one 14-oz. can of lentil soup.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'The chipotle purée can be made in advance, stored in an airtight container, and refrigerated for up to 2 months. Put the chipotle peppers and adobo sauce in a small food processor or blender.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Pour 3 cups of water into a 7-quart slow cooker. Add the ham, cut-side up, as well as the parsnips and carrots. Cook on high, uncovered, for 30 to 45 minutes. Cover the slow cooker and cook on low until the ham is tender, 3 to 4 hours.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Cook bacon in a 6-quart heavy pot over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp. Peel and core 1 apple and coarsely chop. Peel potatoes and chop them.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Pat chicken dry; season outside and inside all over with salt. Arrange breast side up in a cast-iron skillet and tuck wings underneath. Finely grate half of zest of 1 lemon into a large bowl; cut lemon in half and squeeze juice.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Melt 2 Tbsp. butter in a large high-sided skillet over medium-high heat. Add leeks and half of lemon zest, season with salt and pepper, and mix to coat leeks in butter. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until leeks are somewhat tender, about 5 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Mash masa, 1 Tbsp. lard, 1 tsp. Diamond Crystal or ½ tsp. Morton salt, and 1 cup water in a medium bowl until a soft and slightly sticky dough forms. Cover and let sit at least 30 minutes and up to 3 hours. Bring guajillo chiles, morita chiles and coriander to a boil in'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Cook chorizo, breaking up with a wooden spoon, until browned and cooked through. Add garlic and ½ onion to same skillet, season with salt, and cook, tossing occasionally, until tender and beginning to brown, 6–8 minutes. Add beans and broth to blender and purée until smooth.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high. Cook plantains, turning once, until deep golden brown. Transfer to paper towels to drain; season with salt.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Melt 4 Tbsp. butter in a small saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring often, until butter foams, then browns, 5–8 minutes. Season chicken all over with 4 tsp. salt. Chill at least 1 hour and up to 1 day.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'The pickled ginger can be refrigerated for a couple of months. The sunchoke chips can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for a day or two.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Pumpkin falafels are a traditional falafel recipe. They are served with yoghurt, tahini and a pickled carrot slaw.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F) Place squash, cut side up, onto a baking tray. Combine the oil, maple, chile, salt and pepper and brush over the squash. Cover with aluminium foil and roast for 20 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a large bowl, stir together the paneer, confectioners’ sugar, and cardamom. Add the semolina, ghee, and milk and whisk until smooth. Stir in the cashews and raisins and set aside. Preheat the oven to 350°F.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a medium saucepan, heat the milk to 195°F over medium heat. Stir frequently during the heating process to prevent the milk from scalding. The milk will become foamy and bubbles will form on its surface once it reaches the desired temperature.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In an ovenproof 12-inch sauté pan or skillet set over medium heat, cook 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and the minced garlic. Combine the carrot, tomatoes plus their juice, and 1 cup water in a blender. Top each section of spinach with a cracked egg.'}]

[{'summary_text': ' Peel your onions and cut them in half through their stem ends. Slice them thinly with the grain, following the line from root to stem rather than cutting the onion across its belly.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Roast squash until fork-tender (it will be a little caramelized in spots), 25–30 minutes. Set 8 roasted squash wedges (or about 2 cups if using butternut) aside for serving.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Coconut oil, brown sugar, cumin, garlic, ají dulce, coconut milk and broth. Add the pumpkin and simmer for 15 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Eggplants should be soft to the touch and pulpy, and should easily come away from the skin. Prepare a hot grill or preheat the broiler. Garnish with the cilantro and serve with roti.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Combine the curry powder with just enough water to form a thick paste. Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add the curry paste and onion. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 to 2 minutes over medium-low heat.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Cardamom seeds, coriander, seeds, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and curry leaves toasted. Grind the mixture to a find powder. Store in an airtight container.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Garlic, onions, celery, and bell peppers cook in oil over moderately low heat. Add all remaining ingredients except shrimp and simmer, uncovered, 30 minutes. Stir in shrimp and cook, covered, over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until shrimp are cooked through, about 5 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Use immediately, or store in a tightly sealed glass jar in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. Process all the ingredients in a food processor until the mixture forms a thick paste.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'In Tobago, pelau is often made with crab. West Indian pumpkin (also called calabaza) is ideal for this recipe. Chicken is the most common meat in pelau.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Mashed potatoes can be made 2 hours ahead; cover and store at room temperature. Or chill, covered, up to 8 hours.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Combine all the ingredients in a chilled rocks glass. Add one large ice cube and stir for 10 seconds. Garnish with an orange twist.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a large heavy-bottomed sauté pan, heat the butter until melted. Stir in the granulated sugar, brown sugar, and honey and let cook until bubbling. Add the apples and toss to coat. Cook for about 4 minutes, or until the apples just start to soften.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Warm the milk and buttermilk to 85°F. Add one-quarter of the rennet tablet and transfer the mixture to a plastic container or bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and then poke a few holes to allow the steam to escape. Let stand at room temperature in a cool spot in your house for 48 hours.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Whisk milk powder, baking powder, granulated sugar, and 2 cups (240 g) flour in a large shallow bowl. Add about a fourth of ¾ cup warm water (110°) and mix in a wide circular motion with your fingers to gently combine (do not knead)'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Peel eggs and halve lengthwise. Carefully remove yolks and mash in a bowl with a fork. Add mayonnaise, mustard, and cayenne and stir with fork. Fill pastry bag with yolk mixture and pipe into egg whites.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Tempering is a traditional method of extracting optimal flavor from Indian spices. Reducing the heat a little before adding the spices prevents the spices from burning. If they do burn, simply start again with fresh spices.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Piloncillo, canela, cardamom, allspice, peppercorns, salt, and 1 cup water to a boil. Add orange zest; let cool.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Pumpkin butter, pumpkin purée, eggs, milk, cinnamon, allspice, ginger, nutmeg, salt, and butter are all needed. Dutch baby batter is made by blending 3 large eggs in a blender for 1 minute.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Swirl 1 Tbsp. oil in a large Dutch oven or other heavy pot to coat and heat over medium-high. Place 2 chicken legs, skin side down, in pot, making sure skin is in direct contact with pan. Cook, undisturbed, until dark golden, about 5 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Peel the potatoes and slice them ⅛-inch thick. In a skillet, cook the onion and 2 tablespoons of the butter over moderately low heat, stirring, until it is very soft. Spread about one third of the sauce in the bottom of a well-buttered 3-quart gratin dish at least 2 ½-inches deep.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Mix all the marinade ingredients together in a mixing bowl. Preheat your oven to its highest setting. Line a baking tray with baking paper.Spread the salmon out on the prepared baking tray and roast for 10 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Mix all the marinade ingredients together in a mixing bowl. Preheat your oven to its highest setting. Line a baking tray with baking paper.Spread the salmon out on the prepared baking tray and roast for 10 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'To make the “beet water,” roughly chop 2 pounds of the beets (select the smaller ones) Place the chopped beets in a large stockpot. Add 10 cups of water and 1 tablespoon vinegar. Place the stockpot over high heat and bring to a boil.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Coat fillets all over with marinade, rubbing into score marks. Roast chips, turning halfway through, until golden brown and crisp. Serve with shito and lemon wedges alongside.'}]
[{'summary_text': "West African pantry staples can be found at Zoe's Ghana Kitchen. The amount of chile described in this recipe is what I would classify as pretty hot."}]
[{'summary_text': "West African pantry staples can be found at Zoe's Ghana Kitchen. The amount of chile described in this recipe is what I would classify as pretty hot."}]

[{'summary_text': 'Put the tomato in a blender and purée, then strain through a fine-mesh sieve. Add the butter to a large skillet and gently cook until it starts to brown and smell nutty. Stir in the smooth tomato purée and simmer for another minute or so.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Roast for 40 to 60 minutes, depending on the size of the squash, until tender when pierced with a small knife. Drizzle lightly with extra maple syrup, sprinkle with sea salt, and serve hot.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium. Cook chile, ginger, garlic, and 2 sliced scallions, tossing, until softened. Add turmeric and cook, stirring frequently, just until darkened and fragrant. Add corn and increase heat to medium-high.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Pulse crackers and ¼ tsp. salt in a food processor until fine crumbs form. Add eggs and 6 Tbsp. garlic butter and pulse until mixture is consistency of wet sand. Transfer to springform pan and press crumbs firmly onto bottom and 1½" up sides of pan. Bake crust until edge is just starting to take on color, 8–'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Heat 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Toss scallions, ginger, and garlic in a medium bowl to combine. Using a mortar and pestle or the side of a chef’s knife, coarsely crush coriander seeds.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Bring chicken, 3 Tbsp. kosher salt, and 5 cups water to a bare simmer in a medium pot over medium heat (chicken should be submerged) Reduce heat to low and cook until juices run clear when thickest part of chicken is pierced, 8–10 minutes. Transfer chicken to a medium bowl; discard poaching liquid.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Olive oil, garlic, tomato paste, maple syrup, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, and Sriracha. Barbecue sauce can be made 2 weeks ahead.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Melt butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Add pine nuts and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Add dried currants and cook, stirring often, until plump, about 1 minute. Combine egg yolks, kefir, and 1½ cups dill in a blender.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Mix ginger and 2 Tbsp. oil in a medium bowl. Add cod and season with salt and sprinkle all over with pepper. Cook cod until golden underneath, about 2 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Process one third of salmon (about 8 oz.) in a food processor until very smooth and paste-like. Add remaining salmon and pulse until pieces are no bigger than ¼," 4–5 times. Transfer to a parchment-lined rimmed baking sheet and cover with plastic wrap. Chill at least 1 hour or up to 3 hours.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Bring guajillo and morita chiles and 1½ cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Cover, remove from heat, and let sit 30 minutes to allow chiles to soften. Transfer chile mixture and soaking liquid to a blender. Add orange juice, achiote paste, 4 garlic cloves, ¼ cup lime juice, and 1 T'}]

[{'summary_text': "Pulse any dried fruit larger than a raisin in food processor until size of chocolate chips. Add remaining 1 cup oats and stir to combine, breaking up any fruit that is stuck together. Add peanut butter, but don't stir it in; set aside."}]

[{'summary_text': 'Rinse lentils, then soak in 2 cups water at room temperature at least 1 hour and up to 12 hours. Drain lentils and transfer to a food processor. Add chile powder, turmeric, and ¾ tsp. salt.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Sauté onions for 15–20 minutes, until golden brown. Transfer onions to a baking sheet lined with paper towels. Store in an airtight container for up to 7 days.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Dressing: Sour cream, mayonnaise, onion powder, mustard, and pepper. Potatoes: Place potatoes in a large pot and pour in 3 qt. water to cover. Add 1 cup salt and bring water to a boil over medium-high heat.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Mix coriander, cumin, termeric, and red pepper flakes in a small bowl; set aside. Heat 2 Tbsp. oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium. Add garlic and cook, tossing occasionally, until golden brown all over, about 5 minutes. Season chicken with kosher salt and add to skillet.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Pine nuts, cucumbers, olives, onion, herbs, and raisins are just a few of the ingredients. The meatballs are the most important part.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Make the crust: Crumble the crackers and cookies into a medium bowl. Add ⅓ cup (75 ml) of the condensed milk and stir until very well combined. Bake until the crust looks a little darker and smells sweet and toasty.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Bake cake until tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 50 minutes. Cool cake completely in pan.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Cook the pasta until al dente. Add the hazelnuts to a small skillet over medium heat. Toast them slowly, shaking the pan often, until lightly browned.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a 10-inch cast-iron skillet over medium, heat 1 tablespoon of the cooking fat. Add the diced white part of the scallions and the minced garlic and cook, stirring often, until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Stir in the potato mixture and the scallion greens. Pour the egg mixture over the veggie mixture in the skillet.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a large, wide bowl, combine the flour, salt, and parsley. Add the butter pieces and, using a pastry blender or your fingertips, cut them up and into the flour mixture until it resembles little pebbles. Pat the dough into a disk, wrap it in plastic, and chill it in the fridge for 1 hour or up to 2 days.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Preheat oven to 425°. Finely grind coriander seeds in a spice mill or with a mortar and pestle. Season each pork chop all over with 1 tsp. salt and let sit at least 1 hour.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Put the dashi in a stockpot or other large pot set over medium-high heat and bring to a simmer. Whisk in the doenjang and cook for 10 minutes to bring out its natural sweetness. Add the gochujang and simmer for 5 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Mix the rice syrup, soy sauce, sugar, vinegar, and mustard in a small bowl. Add the chicken and peanuts (if using) to the bubbling sauce. Sprinkle with the toasted sesame seeds and a few teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes. Transfer to a large plate or platter and serve.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'The pork belly must be marinated overnight. The sugars in the marinade will char and caramelize, giving you a more interesting texture.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'The pork belly must be marinated overnight. The sugars in the marinade will char and caramelize, giving you a more interesting texture.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Whisk egg yolks, sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a medium bowl. Add butter and rub and smash into dry ingredients with your fingers to create large, shaggy pieces. Divide dough in half, stack pieces, and press down firmly to smash together.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Rice is best done in a rice cooker. Coconut cream is a great addition to the rice.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Lemon zest, butter, cinnamon, sugar, salt and flour are all needed. Toast sesame seeds on a rimmed baking sheet for 12–15 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Beat together butter and remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Reduce speed to low and mix in nut mixture until just combined.Spread frangipane filling evenly in tart shell. Brush pears (not filling) with preserves.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Bread crumbs, anchovies, garlic, and red pepper flakes are all needed. Broccoli florets should be cooked until bright green and crisp-tender.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Put water, dashima, shiitake mushrooms, and anchovies in a covered stockpot or other large pot. Let stand at room temperature overnight or for 8 to 12 hours. Taste the dashi every 20 minutes to monitor the changes in flavor and texture.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'This rejuvenating drink combines the mild heat of young ginger and the sourness of tamarind. Young ginger requires no peeling before use because its outer skin is so thin. I recommend using South Asian Tamarind which is a lot more sour than the Mexican variety.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Sumac is rich in citric, malic, and tartaric acids but also bitter tannins. Steeping it in water dissolves the water-soluble acids. Saffron is ground to a fine powder using a little sugar as an abrasive.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F), Gas Mark 4. Lightly grease a 13x9" baking tin. Line with a piece of parchment paper that overhangs the two long sides. Secure in place with metal clips.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Warm 3 teaspoons of the oil in a frying pan over medium-low heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes, stirring gently. Add garlic and continue to cook for 3 minutes. Turn the heat to medium and add the chiles. Cook for 10 minutes.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Toss scallions and cilantro in a small bowl to combine. Squeeze in juice from lime, season with salt, and toss again. Smear kimchi cream cheese over each slice of bread.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Scallions, ginger, tomatoes and soy sauce are the stars of this recipe.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Heat ½ cup oil in a large heavy pot over low. Add garlic and cook, stirring often with a wooden spoon, until softened but not browned. Add tomatoes, basil sprigs, red pepper flakes, and 1½ tsp. salt. Cook, stirring to coat, until some of the tomatoes begin to burst and release their juices, about 4 minutes.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Crackers, peanuts, brown sugar, salt and butter are all needed. Crust can be baked 3 days ahead. Store tightly wrapped at room temperature or freeze up to 1 month.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Cut tofu crosswise into ½"-thick slabs, then cut each slab on a diagonal to create 2 triangles. Heat 2 Tbsp. grapeseed oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high. Add tofu in a single layer, season with salt, and cook, undisturbed, until golden brown underneath, about 4 minutes.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Lemon zest, garlic, and za’atar oil can be used to make a simple salad. Add feta, basil, mint, and reserved tomatoes to bowl with chips.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Nestle chicken thighs into tomatoes, skin side up. Break feta into large pieces; scatter over chicken.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Do Ahead: Dressing can be made 1 day ahead. Purée jalapeños, ginger, garlic, cilantro, lime juice, tahini, miso, and 3 Tbsp. water in a blender.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Pulse pistachios in a food processor until finely ground. Press dough evenly into bottom and about 2" up sides of pan with a straight-sided glass or measuring cup. Chill while you make the filling.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Preheat the oven to 400°F. Place the whole bananas or plantains on a baking sheet and bake, turning them every 10 minutes, until the peel starts to split and the inside is tender. Carefully slice the peel lengthwise to just reveal the flesh and drizzle with some crema and sprinkle with cheese.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Chorizo, beef, tomatoes, corn, cheese, jalapeños, and cornbread are just a few ingredients. The cornbread is then baked until golden brown.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Arrange bacon in a cold large cast-iron skillet and set over medium heat. Whisk garlic, pickle brine, mustard, and salt in a large bowl. Add tomatoes and pickled peppers and gently toss to combine.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Trim the stalks from the eggplants, then insert a manakra (or peeler or corer) into the eggplant; you want it to be very close to the skin. Scoop out the flesh to create a generous cavity. If making in advance, keep in the fridge until ready to use.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'To make the meatballs, place the breadcrumbs in a small bowl and cover with water. Add the chicken, garlic, spices, herbs, lemon zest, and plenty of black pepper. Using well-oiled hands, shape into about 30 small balls; roughly a scant 1 oz/25g each.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Using the Sauté function on High, heat 1 teaspoon (5 mL) oil in the inner pot for 1 minute, until shimmering. Add the coconut, coriander seeds, chana dal, peppercorns, fenugreek seeds, cinnamon stick, cloves, asafoetida (if using) and dried chile; cook for'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Process walnuts in a food processor until a paste forms. Spread out walnuts on a small rimmed baking sheet; toast, tossing halfway through.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Mix vermouth, lemon juice, simple syrup, and 2 of the orange slices in a cocktail shaker. Add ice cubes to fill the shaker three-quarters full, cover, and shake to chill.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Muddle the strawberries in a mixing glass or cocktail shaker. Add the rosé, Aperol, and lemon juice, and stir to incorporate. Pour into a wineglass, add a handful of ice cubes, and top with a splash of soda water.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Mash mushrooms, miso, paprika, and remaining garlic in a medium bowl with a spoon to combine. Add lentils and mix and smash until partly mashed but with lots of whole lentils still remaining. Add flour and vigorously stir until mixture holds together when squeezed in your hand. Form into 6 patties about ¾" thick.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Build in a chilled wine glass filled with ice. Garnish with the cucumber wheel.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Cook noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking. Transfer to a large bowl, add half of reserved dressing, and toss to coat. Top with vegetables and drizzle with remaining dressing.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Whisk sugar, vinegar, and 2 tsp. Diamond Crystal or 1¼ tsp. Morton kosher salt in a small bowl until sugar dissolves. Bring rice, a pinch of salt and 2½ cups cold water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Coarsely crush cumin seeds with a mortar and pestle. Add lemon juice and honey. Whisk in ¼ cup oil, then add chile and ginger. Season dressing with salt.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Bring plums, brown sugar, and salt to a boil in a medium heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve set over a medium bowl, pushing plum flesh through; discard skins. Pour ripple into a jar and let cool, then cover and chill 1 hour before using.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Drain fruit in a fine-mesh sieve set over a small bowl; set fruit aside. Gently toss fruit, chile, vinegar, sugar, and ½ tsp. salt in a medium bowl to combine. Let sit until fruit is spicy and flavorful, about 10 minutes. Gather cilantro into a bundle and cut into 2"-long pieces.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Pork is the star of this recipe. Toast fennel seeds in a dry small skillet over medium heat, tossing often, until golden brown and starting to pop. Add chiles, vinegar, butter, and sugar to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium-high heat.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Bring raspberries, sugar, and ¼ tsp. salt to a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add condensed milk, almond extract, and remaining ¾ tsp. of salt. Beat cream on low speed until billowy and stiff peaks form, about 4 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Just before cream is ready, heat chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water. Using an electric mixer, beat cream, starting on low speed and gradually increasing to medium-high.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Egg yolks, cassava, macapuno (or shredded coconut, if using), coconut milk and the ½ cup sweetened condensed milk are all needed. Preheat the oven to 350°F.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Put the peaches in a 9-by-13-inch (or similar) baking pan or gratin dish. Using a zester or a Microplane, zest the lemon evenly over the fruit and squeeze the lemon juice over the top.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Scallion pancakes are one of the most popular Korean dishes. Make the batter by combining the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, sugar, doenjang, and pepper.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Store for up to 2 weeks in a tightly sealed container in the refrigerator.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'The pickle is ready to eat immediately after it is made, but the flavors are pronounced after a day or two. Use smaller (4 – 6 oz) sanitized and dried glass jars to store the pickle.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Mix all remaining ingredients in a large bowl until well combined. Stir carefully to keep the mango pieces intact. Add onion and mix again. Taste for salt, and adjust if needed.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Mix the flour and pork lard with your fingers until the mixture is the texture of coarse sand. Then add the salt with the hot (but not scalding) water and knead well. Cover with plastic wrap and let sit at room temperature for 1 hour.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Lentils, cheese, sweet peppers, oregano and basil are the main ingredients in this recipe.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Gently mix pistachios, prunes, garlic, parsley, mint, tarragon, kimchi brine, and vinegar in a medium bowl to combine; season with salt. Grill fish, undisturbed, until about 70 percent cooked through (use a knife to slide into flesh to check), about 5 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Whisk vinegar, Aleppo-style pepper, oregano, garlic, and remaining 4 Tbsp. oil in a small bowl to combine. Pour over mushrooms and toss to coat. Add Parmesan, olives, and Peppadew peppers.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Gently mix pistachios, prunes, garlic, parsley, mint, tarragon, kimchi brine, and vinegar. Whisk in oil, then taste and season spoon sauce with more salt if needed.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Whisk labneh (or strained yogurt), condensed milk, lime zest and juice, and salt in a medium bowl until smooth. Fold in granola; scrape ice cream base into a loaf pan. Cover with plastic wrap or an airtight silicone lid and freeze until solid, at least 8 hours.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Grill eggplant over indirect heat, turning occasionally, until completely tender, 1–1½ hours. Meanwhile, grill whole garlic heads over indirectHeat until cloves are tender and jammy, 40–50 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Potatoes, salt, and 1 quart water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until tender, 12–14 minutes; drain. Set a medium skillet, preferably cast iron, on grill. Place butter and miso in skillet and cook, stirring, until butter is melted.'}]
[{'summary_text': ' Combine salt and 3 quarts water in a large pot; stir until salt is dissolved. Add corn; let sit at room temperature at least 2 hours, or cover and chill up to 12 hours.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Use kitchen shears to cut along both sides of the backbone to remove (freeze and save it for stock!). Open chicken and turn skin side up. Press down on center of breast to flatten chicken.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'If using nori, finely grind in a spice mill or mortar and pestle. Mix coriander, mustard powder, brown sugar, pepper, garlic powder, and half of nori powder (if using) This is your dry rub. Mix horseradish, both mustards, and honey in a small bowl to combine; season with salt.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Put all the ingredients in a food processor and blitz until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add some water to loosen the soup if needed.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Cook amaranth according to package directions. Spread out on a rimmed baking sheet and let cool. Combine scallions, mushrooms, chile, black-eyed peas, parsley, tamari, flaxseed meal, miso, and ½ tsp. salt in a food processor. Scoop onto a parchment-lined baking sheet to make 6 portions.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Toss cabbage, green tomatoes, onion, bell peppers, and salt in a large bowl. Add both vinegars, sugar, mustard, and turmeric. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 10 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a small saucepan, combine the oil, garlic, and onion. Cook over low heat until the garlic and onion are golden and tender, about 15 minutes. Place half the fried okra in a large bowl and add the romaine, corn, corn bread, tomatoes and cucumber. Add the dressing and toss until well coated.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Lime zest and juice, chiles, ginger, chopped garlic, scallions, chopped thyme, oil, brown sugar, allspice, salt, black pepper, granulated garlic, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg, cayenne, and cumin. Rub can be made 1 week ahead. Cover and chill.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Brush the peach halves with 1 tablespoon of the blended oil, and place on the grill grates, cut sides down. Grill, uncovered, until grill marks appear and juices begin to release, about 3 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Brush the peach halves with 1 tablespoon of the blended oil, and place on the grill grates, cut sides down. Grill, uncovered, until grill marks appear and juices begin to release, about 3 minutes.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a Dutch oven or sauté pan, heat 2 tablespoons of water over low heat and stir in 1 tablespoon of the awaze. Add the flaxseed and lightly dry-toast for about 2 minutes, stirring and shaking the pan, until aromatic. Transfer to a dish and leave to cool. Once cool, grind using an electric spice or coffee grinder'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Pour chilled mezcal, chilled Lillet blanc, chilled simple syrup, celery bitters, and water into a 2-quart pitcher. Seal well, covering with plastic wrap if needed, and refrigerate. Up to 2 hours before serving, prepare celery and lemon juices.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Shake mezcal, Aperol, maraschino liqueur, and lime juice together with ice. Express the oils from a grapefruit peel over the top of the drink and discard.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Mix all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and dry shake. Strain into a copper mule mug and add fresh rocks. Garnish with a sprig of mint and a quartered lime.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Rim coupe glass with ground pink peppercorn and salt. Combine all other ingredients in a shaker tin with ice. Shake until the tin feels cold.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a cocktail shaker, combine the mezcal, lemon juice, and 3⁄4 ounce of the honey syrup. Fill the shaker three-quarters of the way with ice and shake vigorously for 10 seconds if serving on the rocks.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Muddle the serrano chile with the cilantro leaves in a cocktail shaker. Add the mezcal, pineapple juice, simple syrup, lime juice, and ice cubes. Shake vigorously and strain over the large ice cube in the glass.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain over a large ice cube in a rocks glass. Express the grapefruit twist over the drink and then rest the twist on the cube in the glass.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Muddle the lime disk with cane or simple syrup, then top with rhum. Stir well to mix.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Keep at least 4 hours or up to overnight in a covered container in the refrigerator. If utilizing a punch bowl, pour over a large block of ice to slow dilution.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Combine all the ingredients except the garnish in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until chilled and strain into a double old-fashioned glass. Garnish with the pineapple chunk or leaf (or both)'}]

[{'summary_text': 'In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda. Stir in the chopped ham, scallions if using, thyme, and 1¾ cups (7 ounces) of the Gruyère. Sprinkle the remaining ¼ cup (1 ounce) cheese over the top. Bake until the top springs back when lightly pressed'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Blend garlic, dill, mint, tahini, and ⅓ cup water in a blender or food processor until a thick paste forms. Toast almonds in a dry small skillet over medium heat, tossing occasionally, until golden brown, about 5 minutes.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Pecorino salsa verde is a great way to add a bit of zest to a summer salad. The Pecarino will add some salt, so bear that in mind.'}]

[{'summary_text': 'Drain 2 chunks of hickory, place them on top of the charcoal and set the grate in place. If using a gas grill, wrap the remaining chips in foil and place directly on the hotter side of the grate. Close the lid and close the top vent on a charcoal grill about halfway.'}]
[{'summary_text': 'Preheat the oven to 350°F. Toss the pumpkin seeds with the cayenne, sugar, and 2 teaspoons oil and place on a small baking sheet. Roast for 6 to 10 minutes, until golden.'}]
